attributes.action: treat any petition receiving support from 50.1% of the number of voters in the previous general election as a de facto referundum
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Referendums in the UK are rare, if not extinct.  If an e-petition receives signatures equal to 50.1% of the number of votes in the last general election, it should be considered an indicator of general opinion and thus lead to a national referendum on the issue in question.

Since the number of people required to meet the 50.1% target is large (but still shamefully low given the potential number of voters in the UK!) this mechanism can't be abused and would give an accurate portrayal of the general opinion.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to team@petitions.pm.gov.uk.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
